intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. billetianum, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to orange flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Hieracium. This subspecies is native to Europe and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has small, alternate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant is an herbaceous perennial, typically growing to a height of 10–30 cm.
